result.execSummary:
The defendant Ra Shawn Tyrone Bumpus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may motion the Court for expungement once the defendant attains the age of 25 as long as he successfully completes probation and has no further police contacts.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant Ra Shawn Tyrone Bumpus in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Parties are in receipt of PSI. No additions, corrections or deletions noted by parties. The State has agreed to follow the PSI. DOC recommends 2-3 yrs probation.

BTC: Sent w/held - 2 yrs probation on both counts. Deft may motion the court for expungement once deft attains the age of 25 as long as he successfully completes probation and has no further police contacts.

obey all rules and regs
costs

any counseling deemed approp by agent
do not associate with any known drug dealers or users

If revoked, IS eligible for CIP and ERP

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Ra Shawn Tyrone Bumpus in court with attorney Erin J Larsen.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Offer has been made.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Ra Shawn Tyrone Bumpus in court with attorney Michelle M Anderson.  Defendant Ra Shawn Tyrone Bumpus in custody.  Bridget Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
